snippet: Although not unprecedented, the step dealt a blow to European pride in freedom of movement — and signaled that Germany’s patience was spent.
abstract: Germany reimposes border controls days after Chancellor Angela Merkel’s open border policy inundates country with tide of migrants and refugees that overwhelmed its resources and good intentions; record 13,000 migrants enter Germany in one day, causing state officials in Berlin, Munich, Budapest and Brussels to denounce hastily instituted policy that left them with few resources and little time to figure out how to accommodate relentless flow.

byline.original: By ALISON SMALE and MELISSA EDDY

lead_paragraph: Although not unprecedented, the step dealt a blow to European pride in freedom of movement — and signaled that Germany’s patience was spent.

headline.main: Numbers of Migrants and Unrest Prompted Germany’s Border Controls
headline.print_headline: Sheer Numbers and Fear of Unrest Prompted Germany’s Border Controls

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
